---
title: "삼각함수 정리"
date: "2024-10-05"
categories: ["기초공학수학"]
---

- $lim{θ→0} \frac{sin θ}{θ} = 1$
- $(sin x)' = cos x$
- $(cos x)' = -sin x$
- $(tan x)' = sec^2 x$
- $(cot x)' = -csc^2 x$
- $(sec x)' = sec x tan x$
- $(csc x)' = -csc x cot x$
- $1 + tan^2 x = sec^2 x$
- $1 + cot^2 x = csc^2 x$
- $sin 2θ = 2 sin θ cos θ$
- $sin^2 θ = \frac{1 - cos 2θ}{2}$
- $cos^2 θ = \frac{1 + cos 2θ}{2}$
- $cos 2θ = cos^2 θ - sin^2 θ = 2cos^2 θ - 1 = 1 - 2sin^2 θ$
- $tan 2θ = \frac{2tan θ}{1 - tan^2 θ}$
